decorator.title: Decorator
decorator.desc: Decorators are non-interactive elements that add visual clarity or separation while minimizing noise or disruption from other elements on the page.

badge.title: Badge
badge.desc: Badges convey dynamic, temporary information, such as counts or status. A badge can include labels or numbers.

spinner.title: Spinner
spinner.desc: Spinners are used when performing actions cause by the user. Spinner use animation to capture attention and inform users of an activity’s progress.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.desc: Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

dialog.title: Dialog
dialog.desc: Dialogs are temporary overlay announcement or command,  on top of the main content of a webpage or application.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.desc: Avatars are visual representations of users that leverage images, icons, or text. They also can contain a presence indicator which shows the user’s status on the product.

progress_bar.title: Progress Bar
progress_bar.desc: The progress bar is used to visually represent the completion of a both determinate and indeterminate task. It is used to  show how much of the task has been completed and how much is  left.

chip.title: Chip
chip.desc: Chips are used to show added items within a form, make selections, filter content, or trigger interaction. These items can be valid or invalid.

list.title: List
list.desc: The list component is a UI element that displays a list of selectable options for the user. It can contain a variety of other components like images, avatars, controls, icons, or multiple lines of text.

toggle.title: Toggle
toggle.desc: A toggle is used to switch between two possible states, commonly used for turning on/off certain features or views.

tab.title: Tab
tab.desc: Tabs are a navigational component used to organize and navigate between different sections of content.

stepper.title: Stepper
stepper.desc: Steppers is a visual representation of a user’s progress through a set of steps. Each of the steps are guiding toward the completion of a specified process or a task.

typography.title: Typography
typography.desc: The key goal of our entire visual system is to present information as clearly as possible. Well-executed typography that works within the system creates harmony and balance.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.desc: Accessibility is the inclusive practice of ensuring that everyone has equal access to information, functionality, and experiences.

motion.title: Motion
motion.desc: Momentum's motion design enhances interactions, bridging the gap between humans and interfaces.  Without it, interactions feel robotic, lacking the expected flow.

iconography.title: Iconography
iconography.desc: The key goal of our entire visual system is to present information as clearly as possible. Well-executed typography that works within the system creates harmony and balance.

color_token.title: Color token
color_token.desc: Color creates meaning and communicates hierarchy, state, and brand. Momentum color palette is timeless, modern and vibrant, like our brand personality.

illustration.title: Illustration
illustration.desc: We simplify complex ideas with our unique illustrations, making them universally clear and memorable, while allowing our brand personality to evolve unexpectedly.

grid_&_layout.title: Grid & Layout
grid_&_layout.desc: The Grid is an overarching guide to the placement of components and elements. Aligning to the grid ensures consistency, visual balance and rhythm.

index.title: Index
index.desc: Discover Momentum design system resources, offering support for contribution, bugs and assets such as icons and illustrations.
